episode_event_ch0294_00_grusha/4001_1101:
Grusha and [Name:PlayerNickname ] were
having a battle in a town on Pasio.
episode_event_ch0294_00_grusha/4001_1001:
I really felt the fiery passion you put into your
Pokémon battles!

If that’s how you felt, then I guess I’ve made
some progress.

Lately, I’ve been wanting to put more of myself
into being a Gym Leader.

In that case, I’ve got your back as a fellow
Pokémon Trainer...

Er, I mean, as a fellow Gym Leader—and I’ll
challenge you to electrifying battles!

Seems like you’re going through some
stuff yourself.

Oh, sorry. We got carried away with
our conversation.

Thanks, [Name:PlayerNickname ]. I’m glad we
got to battle.

It reminded me of how passionate and fun
Pokémon battles can be.

And there’s something about you that reminds me
of that one challenger...
Are you by chance Grusha the snowboarder?
episode_event_ch0294_00_grusha/6001_1031:
I’ve opened up a
new horizon.
episode_event_ch0294_00_grusha/6001_1001:
When you’re about to face a challenge, backing
off takes its own kind of courage.
But I know it takes courage to push forward, too.

So I’ll fearlessly take the next step forward here
on Pasio, a new land.
episode_event_ch0294_00_grusha/4002_1001: Who are you?
Sorry, I haven’t introduced myself. I’m Malva.

I’m a news reporter in Kalos and a member of the
Elite Four of the Pokémon League.
A member of the Kalos Elite Four, huh...

I have a friend who’s also a Fire-type Pokémon
user and an Elite Four member, but you seem
pretty different from him.
*chuckle* I’ve heard about your friend.
So...

what does a news reporter from Kalos want
from me?

As someone in the media, I’ve known about your
fame for quite some time now.
So, I wanted to chat with you.

After all, you’re not just a young, talented Gym
Leader in Paldea...

You’re also the second-best snowboarder in
the world—
Ah, excuse me.
I meant “former” snowboarder.
What are you trying to say?

Sorry. It seems I still had the past news reports
about you on my mind...

I apologize if I made you feel uncomfortable in
any way.

I was just curious if you were at all interested in
returning to snowboarding.

I won’t hang on to a dream I’ve already given
up on.
My path as a snowboarder has been closed off...

But now, I have Pokémon battles—that’s the path
I’ve chosen.

I met a Trainer in Paldea who I battled with full
force, but I lost to them anyway. It made me
feel...frustrated.

They were just like [Name:PlayerNickname ],
who I battled earlier.

Right now, I want to become stronger as a
Gym Leader. I don’t plan on making a comeback
as a snowboarder.
All right. But...

I can see in your eyes that the fire you once had 
as a snowboarder is still smoldering.

Or is it a flame of rage toward the fact that your
dream was taken away for a reason you just can’t
accept?

A flame that looks close to being extinguished but
just won’t go out...
It’s very fascinating.
Hey, don’t you think you’re going too far?
I’ll be keeping my eye on you, Grusha.
episode_event_ch0294_00_grusha/4003_1001:
I keep thinking about what that woman said
to me.

I can’t believe I’m letting what she said get to me.
I thought I’d gotten over everything.
episode_event_ch0294_00_grusha/4003_0301: Some people are worried about you
episode_event_ch0294_00_grusha/4003_0302: I want you to meet some people
episode_event_ch0294_00_grusha/4003_1001:
I’m honestly not really in the mood to talk...but
sure, let’s do it.
Maybe I’ll at least feel a little better.
episode_event_ch0294_00_grusha/4004_1001:
You must be Grusha. I’ve been wanting to
meet you.

We wanted to speak to you as fellow Ice-type
Gym Leaders.
Then you two must be...

Precisely. I’m Pryce, Gym Leader of Mahogany
Town in Johto.

And I’m Brycen—former Gym Leader of Icirrus City
in Unova.
We heard about your situation, Grusha.

You were once an accomplished professional
snowboarder, but you had no choice but to give
up on that career.

Yeah, that’s right. If you got something you wanna
say to me, too—
I’ve been where you are.
Huh?

It was a different path than yours, but I once had
to retire from my career as an actor.

I challenged myself to perform a dangerous stunt
and ended up badly injuring myself. I was young
and overconfident back then.

If you think you’ve got what it takes, come take
me on!
Young and overconfident, huh...

Afterward, I devoted myself to being a Gym
Leader for a while...

But eventually, I was able to return to the career I
had retired from and act again.

I’m not saying I understand everything you’re
going through...

but as someone who has experienced failure and
suffered setbacks, I can say this—
The present isn’t everything.

Easy for you to say—you’ve already overcome
your challenges.
That’s true.
However, your past experiences are an asset.

I believe that everything that happened in the
past—our failures and our successes—makes us
who we are in the present.
Yes... That’s correct.

I was able to return to acting during my time
as a Gym Leader...

because I acknowledged my failures and
recognized that I still had a lot to learn.
So, Grusha...

There’s no need for you to completely throw away
your passion for snowboarding. Wouldn’t you
agree?

Your past failures and aspirations are important
things that have shaped who you are right now.

I’m certain these experiences and emotions will
help you on your path as a Gym Leader.
Besides...

you still don’t know where the course of your life
will take you, do you?
Well...

“There is strength in being with other people
and Pokémon.”
“Receiving their support makes you stronger.”

My mentor told me that when I was feeling down
after my injury.
Strength in being with Pokémon...

One may feel discouraged in the midst of a harsh
winter.

But eventually, the snow will melt, and a warm
spring will arrive... That’s what life is all about.
There’s no need for you to worry.

There are people and Pokémon by your side who
will support you, right?

Judging from your looks...I didn’t expect you two
to say such cool things.
But...thank you.

My path looked hazy at first, but I think it’s starting
to clear up now.
You’re right... I just have to keep moving forward.

Sorry to bother you, Cetitan...but could you help
me out with something?
episode_event_ch0294_00_grusha/4005_1001: Oh? We meet again.
Hi, Grusha.

Good timing. I was just thinking about asking you
to battle me.
Oh, why’s that?
I acknowledge what you said to me the other day.

I haven’t completely thrown away my identity as
a snowboarder.
But because of that...

I’ve solidified my decision to focus on being a
Gym Leader.

Wouldn’t it be uncool if I gave in to being a Gym
Leader just ’cause I had no other choice?
Yes, that’s true.

The slopes I went down as a pro snowboarder
weren’t for nothing.

I want to focus on the slope ahead of me...and
I’ll use what I’ve learned from my past failures
and successes to make sure I don’t wipe out.

It might lead me to a bright future or a steep
fall... I don’t know.

I’ll still make it all the way to the end, no matter
what twists and turns the snow-capped mountains
throw at me.

I’ll ride this course of life with everyone—including
my Pokémon.
I see...

What an impressive goal. I can feel your heart
burning up with determination.
So, with all that said...

I want to challenge you to a battle to prove that
I’m not all just talk. Is that cool with you?
Yes, of course.
My emotions are so inflamed now.

The fire within you right now... I’m not against
it, personally.

I don’t get you... You tried to pick a fight with me
earlier, and now you’re suddenly praising me...
Well, whatever.

I’ll chill you to the bone... I just want to know
what your true intention is.
